title: Golf Drives
question_text:
A local driving range keeps track of the distances its clients hit golf balls. Distances are normally distributed and have a standard deviation of $43\text{ yards}$.
If a $350\text{ yard}$ drive puts an individual in the top $1\%$ of all drives, what is the mean of this distribution?
solution:
This problem tests studentsâ€™ ability to use the normal tables and algebra to solve for the mean. Using Table A from your AP Statistics tables, you can find where the $z$-value would be for approximately $0.9900$, which ends up being at $2.3$ and $0.03$ with a $p$-value of $0.9901$.

Set up the following equation and solve for $x$ to get $x = 250$:

$$\frac{350-x}{43} = 2.33$$

$$350-x=100.19$$

$$-x=-249.81$$

$$x=249.81$$

Choice 'A' is correct.
